titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Syria Collection of photographs AD.MC.036
titlestmt.author: Jasmine Soliman and Emily Broad, with additional edits by Jonathan Burr and Ozge Calafato for Akkasah: Center for Photography at NYUAD

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 19:13:30 +0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

physdesc.extent: 1,255 photographs and 25 negatives in 8 boxes and 1 oversized flat box.

did.abstract: Acquired from photographer Xenia Nikolskaya and researcher Heba Habib, the Syria Collection includes 1281 photographs including black and white gelatin silver prints and color photographs. The images document the social and cultural life of Syria from the 1940's to the 1980's. They portray religious ceremonies, daily life, street scenes of Damascus, archaeological sites, schools, picnics, family trips, costume parties, historic sites, and landscapes.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into ten series according to the order in which the materials were received from the donor.
The series and subseries arrangement of the records is as follows:

Marie Rose Krikorian Series - Box: 5; Box: 9 Adel Bassem Series Studio Portraits Amphitheater Series - Box: 4 Actor Headshots Series Series - Box: 5 Party Series Series - Box: 5 Aleppo Series Series - Box: 6 Studio Series II Series - Box: 7 Studio Series III Series - Box: 8 Wedding Portrait Series

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials were placed in new acid-free folders and boxes. Original caption information, when available, was transcribed into ArchivesSpace. The language of the original captions was retained in the digitisation of both the recto and verso of each photograph.
As of December 2019, 781 photographs have been digitised and published to a finding aid and o akkasah.org, with 474 remaining.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Acquired from photographer Xenia Nikolskaya and researcher Heba Habib, the Syria Collection includes 1,255 photographs including black and white gelatin silver prints and color photographs, as well as 25 negatives. The images document the social and cultural life of Syria from the 1940's to the 1980's. They portray religious ceremonies, daily life, street scenes of Damascus, archaeological sites, schools, picnics, family trips, costume parties, historic sites, and landscapes. There are also 10 photographs taken in Lebanon.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: NYU Abu Dhabi holds all copyright and related rights pertaining to this collection. Please contact Akkasah Photography Archive at akkasah@nyu.edu for information regarding information and use or submit an image request form via akkasah.org .

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: All images acquired from Xenia Nikolskaya in 2018.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Syria Collection; AD_MC_036; box number; folder number or item identifier; Akkasah Photography Archive, al Mawrid, New York University Abu Dhabi.
